sn22.48:1.2: “Mendicants, I will teach you the five aggregates and the five grasping aggregates.
sn22.48:1.4: And what are the five aggregates?
sn22.48:1.5: Any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; solid or subtle; inferior or superior; far or near: this is called the aggregate of form.
sn22.48:1.6: Any kind of feeling at all …
sn22.48:1.7: Any kind of perception at all …
sn22.48:1.8: Any kind of choices at all …
sn22.48:1.9: Any kind of consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; solid or subtle; inferior or superior; far or near: this is called the aggregate of consciousness.
sn22.48:1.10: These are called the five aggregates.
sn22.48:2.1: And what are the five grasping aggregates?
sn22.48:2.2: Any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near, which is accompanied by defilements and fuels grasping: this is called the grasping aggregate of form.
sn22.48:2.3: Any kind of feeling at all …
sn22.48:2.4: Any kind of perception at all …
sn22.48:2.5: Any kind of choices at all …
sn22.48:2.6: Any kind of consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near, which is accompanied by defilements and is fuels grasping: this is called the grasping aggregate of consciousness.
sn22.48:2.7: These are called the five grasping aggregates.”
